  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HSE Officer",
  "description": "Grand Oak Limited (GOL) -&nbsp;We are the largest Manufacturer of SpiritsandWines, we believe our spirits should have character; an authenticity derived from where they are distilled, bottled and the philosophies of those who distil them.

There are many attributes that describe us resolute, self-sufficient, tough, hard-working, enduring, emotional, passionate, philosophical and engaging.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Sango Ota, Ogun

Job Description


	The HSE Officer shall take responsibility for managing their master data set, developing reports, and troubleshooting data issues.


Responsibilities


	Monitor Health and Safety.
	Responsible for detecting, monitoring, and assessing hazardous and unsafe situations.
	Correct unsafe acts or conditions through the regular line of authority.
	Investigate accidents that have occurred within incident areas.
	Conducts investigations of all accidents and near-misses.
	Issues PPE, take stock levels and alert when low stock is attained.
	Carry out PTW Monitoring and review.
	Ensure proper traffic management within the site and outside in cases of road work.
	Ensure proper waste management (Waste segregation, storage, and disposal).
	Trains and carries out drills and exercises on how to manage emergency situations.
	Ensure PPE compliance is maintained.
	Oversee total plant safety measures are adhered to.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a&nbsp;Diploma in Occupational health and safety, Engineering related Science course.
	Basic HSE certifications &ndash; Mandatory


The Person Must:


	Be proficient in Microsoft office applications (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint).
	Have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Have flexibility to environment and people.
	Have excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Have excellent logic, analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Be able to use Microsoft office suites packages.


Experience:&nbsp;


	Minimum of 5 years HSE experience.
	2-3 years of experience in manufacturing industry/ petrochemical industry.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 monthly.",

HSE Officer Job at Grand Oak Limited




        
    

        
        Grand Oak Limited (GOL) - We are the largest Manufacturer of SpiritsandWines, we believe our spirits should have character; an authenticity derived from where they are distilled, bottled and the philosophies of those who distil them.

There are many attributes that describe us resolute, self-sufficient, tough, hard-working, enduring, emotional, passionate, philosophical and engaging.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Officer

Job Location: Sango Ota, Ogun

Job Description
     

            
    




	The HSE Officer shall take responsibility for managing their master data set, developing reports, and troubleshooting data issues.


Responsibilities


	Monitor Health and Safety.
	Responsible for detecting, monitoring, and assessing hazardous and unsafe situations.
	Correct unsafe acts or conditions through the regular line of authority.
	Investigate accidents that have occurred within incident areas.
	Conducts investigations of all accidents and near-misses.
	Issues PPE, take stock levels and alert when low stock is attained.
	Carry out PTW Monitoring and review.
	Ensure proper traffic management within the site and outside in cases of road work.
	Ensure proper waste management (Waste segregation, storage, and disposal).
	Trains and carries out drills and exercises on how to manage emergency situations.
	Ensure PPE compliance is maintained.
	Oversee total plant safety measures are adhered to.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Diploma in Occupational health and safety, Engineering related Science course.
	Basic HSE certifications – Mandatory


The Person Must:


	Be proficient in Microsoft office applications (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint).
	Have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Have flexibility to environment and people.
	Have excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Have excellent logic, analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Be able to use Microsoft office suites packages.


Experience: 


	Minimum of 5 years HSE experience.
	2-3 years of experience in manufacturing industry/ petrochemical industry.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 monthly.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Supervisor, Agent Network",
  "description": "Stanbic IBTC Bank is a leading African banking group focused on emerging markets globally. It has been a mainstay of South Africa&#39;s financial system for 150 years, and now spans 16 countries across the African continent.

Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for resourceful individuals to join our dedicated team at our offices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Supervisor, Agent Network

Job Ref ID: 80449006A-0001
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Job Type: Full-time
Business Segment: Business &amp; Commercial Banking

Job Description


	To implement and drive the Agency Banking business plan in and around assigned geographical location and region whilst monitoring and maintaining the Agent and or client experience and growing the distribution partnership base.
	He / she will be responsible for agent prospecting and relationship management.&nbsp;


Key Responsibilities


	Responsible for building, monitoring, and growing a network of vibrant Agents in the regions of coverage
	Driving and coordinating series of activities involved in identifying, on-boarding, training, and support of Agents
	Initiating and coordinating business development initiatives such as market storms, community activation, Agent forums etc. geared towards the growth and quality of the Agent network
	Working closely with other teams within the Agent Banking department to develop and grow products that meet the specific need of the target market
	Develop, co-ordinate and implement marketing activities to create brand awareness and visibility aimed at driving customer growth and transactions


Qualifications


	Minimum of First degree&nbsp;


Experience Required:


	3 - 4 years of extensive experience in Branch Banking, including identifying key drivers of income and cost lines.
	Experience in growing customer base.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills are crucial.
	The ability to build and maintain relationships, negotiate effectively, and motivate agents to achieve targets is essential.
	Additionally, analytical skills, business acumen, and a strategic mindset are valuable for identifying growth opportunities and optimizing the agent network&#39;s performance will be an added advantage.


Additional Information:
Behavioural Competencies:


	Checking Things
	Developing Expertise
	Establishing Rapport
	Examining Information
	Following Procedures
	Interacting with People
	Meeting Timescales
	Showing Composure
	Team Working
	Thinking Positively
	Understanding People
	Upholding Standards


Technical Competencies:


	Active Listening
	Application &amp; Submission Verification (Business Banking)
	Client Servicing
	Difficult Calls Management
	Query Resolution

Supervisor, Agent Network Job at Stanbic IBTC Bank




        
    

        
        Stanbic IBTC Bank is a leading African banking group focused on emerging markets globally. It has been a mainstay of South Africa's financial system for 150 years, and now spans 16 countries across the African continent.

Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for resourceful individuals to join our dedicated team at our offices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supervisor, Agent Network
     

            
    



Job Ref ID: 80449006A-0001
Job Location: Abuja
Job Type: Full-time
Business Segment: Business & Commercial Banking

Job Description


	To implement and drive the Agency Banking business plan in and around assigned geographical location and region whilst monitoring and maintaining the Agent and or client experience and growing the distribution partnership base.
	He / she will be responsible for agent prospecting and relationship management. 


Key Responsibilities


	Responsible for building, monitoring, and growing a network of vibrant Agents in the regions of coverage
	Driving and coordinating series of activities involved in identifying, on-boarding, training, and support of Agents
	Initiating and coordinating business development initiatives such as market storms, community activation, Agent forums etc. geared towards the growth and quality of the Agent network
	Working closely with other teams within the Agent Banking department to develop and grow products that meet the specific need of the target market
	Develop, co-ordinate and implement marketing activities to create brand awareness and visibility aimed at driving customer growth and transactions


Qualifications


	Minimum of First degree 


Experience Required:


	3 - 4 years of extensive experience in Branch Banking, including identifying key drivers of income and cost lines.
	Experience in growing customer base.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills are crucial.
	The ability to build and maintain relationships, negotiate effectively, and motivate agents to achieve targets is essential.
	Additionally, analytical skills, business acumen, and a strategic mindset are valuable for identifying growth opportunities and optimizing the agent network's performance will be an added advantage.


Additional Information:
Behavioural Competencies:


	Checking Things
	Developing Expertise
	Establishing Rapport
	Examining Information
	Following Procedures
	Interacting with People
	Meeting Timescales
	Showing Composure
	Team Working
	Thinking Positively
	Understanding People
	Upholding Standards


Technical Competencies:


	Active Listening
	Application & Submission Verification (Business Banking)
	Client Servicing
	Difficult Calls Management
	Query Resolution
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Sales Manager (Cassava Starch)",
  "description": "Matna Foods Limited is a leading agro-allied food processing company focused on the production of high-quality, food-grade cassava starch for both local and international markets. Nigeria&rsquo;s pioneer producer of international-standard, multi-use cassava starch, Matna operates a modern processing facility near Akure, Ondo State, strategically located within a major cassava-producing belt.

Matna&rsquo;s operations are anchored on strong process discipline, rigorous quality control, safety standards, and operational excellence required to meet demanding global specifications. By combining advanced processing technology, deep agricultural linkages, and skilled professionals, the company consistently delivers reliable, high-grade starch for a wide range of food and industrial applications.
Driven by a commitment to quality, innovation, and continuous improvement, Matna&rsquo;s products remain highly competitive across domestic and export markets. The company&rsquo;s growth has been guided by visionary leadership and a strong belief in the potential of Nigeria&rsquo;s agricultural value chain&mdash;earning industry recognition, including the CBN Export Category Best SMEEIS Entrepreneur Award. At Matna, we are committed to building a high-performance culture that attracts, develops, and empowers talented professionals who share our passion for excellence, collaboration, and innovation&mdash;creating an environment where ideas thrive, and standards are continually raised.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Manager (Cassava Starch)

Job Location:&nbsp;Ondo

Job Description


	The Sales Manager will lead our market expansion efforts for cassava starch.
	You will be responsible for driving B2B sales, managing key industrial accounts, and establishing Matna Foods as the preferred supplier of high-quality cassava starch for multinational and local manufacturers.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement a robust sales strategy to penetrate the Lagos industrial market.
	Identify and secure new business opportunities within the food and beverage, pharmaceutical, textile, and paper industries.
	Monitor market trends, competitor pricing, and demand fluctuations to provide actionable insights.
	Act as the primary point of contact for high-value industrial clients (Key Accounts).
	Negotiate high-volume supply contracts, ensuring favorable terms and long-term partnerships.
	Conduct regular client visits to ensure product satisfaction and identify upselling opportunities.
	Liaise with the production team at the farm/processing site to ensure product availability aligns with sales forecasts.
	Oversee the logistics of starch delivery within Lagos State to ensure timely and professional distribution.
	Manage credit limits and ensure the timely collection of receivables.
	Prepare weekly and monthly sales reports, forecasting, and budget performance analysis.
	Maintain an updated CRM database of all prospects and existing clients.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Agricultural Science, or a related field.
	Minimum of 6 years of experience in B2B industrial sales, preferably within the FMCG or Agribusiness sector.
	Proven track record of selling industrial raw materials (starch, flour, or sweeteners) to large-scale manufacturers.
	Understanding of the industrial landscape in Lagos (Ikeja, Agbara, Ikorodu, etc.).
	Exceptional ability to close high-stakes deals with procurement managers and directors.
	Ability to discuss product specifications (moisture content, pH levels, viscosity) with client Quality Assurance teams.


Benefits


	Competitive Compensation. &nbsp;&nbsp;
	5-day workweek. &nbsp;&nbsp;
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children). &nbsp;&nbsp;
	Wellness Programs &nbsp;&nbsp;
	Employee Training Programs &nbsp;&nbsp;
	Growth and Development &nbsp;&nbsp;
	Mentoring and Counseling.
",

Sales Manager (Cassava Starch) Job at Matna Foods Limited




        
    

        
        Matna Foods Limited is a leading agro-allied food processing company focused on the production of high-quality, food-grade cassava starch for both local and international markets. Nigeria’s pioneer producer of international-standard, multi-use cassava starch, Matna operates a modern processing facility near Akure, Ondo State, strategically located within a major cassava-producing belt.
     

            
    



Matna’s operations are anchored on strong process discipline, rigorous quality control, safety standards, and operational excellence required to meet demanding global specifications. By combining advanced processing technology, deep agricultural linkages, and skilled professionals, the company consistently delivers reliable, high-grade starch for a wide range of food and industrial applications.
Driven by a commitment to quality, innovation, and continuous improvement, Matna’s products remain highly competitive across domestic and export markets. The company’s growth has been guided by visionary leadership and a strong belief in the potential of Nigeria’s agricultural value chain—earning industry recognition, including the CBN Export Category Best SMEEIS Entrepreneur Award. At Matna, we are committed to building a high-performance culture that attracts, develops, and empowers talented professionals who share our passion for excellence, collaboration, and innovation—creating an environment where ideas thrive, and standards are continually raised.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Manager (Cassava Starch)

Job Location: Ondo

Job Description


	The Sales Manager will lead our market expansion efforts for cassava starch.
	You will be responsible for driving B2B sales, managing key industrial accounts, and establishing Matna Foods as the preferred supplier of high-quality cassava starch for multinational and local manufacturers.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement a robust sales strategy to penetrate the Lagos industrial market.
	Identify and secure new business opportunities within the food and beverage, pharmaceutical, textile, and paper industries.
	Monitor market trends, competitor pricing, and demand fluctuations to provide actionable insights.
	Act as the primary point of contact for high-value industrial clients (Key Accounts).
	Negotiate high-volume supply contracts, ensuring favorable terms and long-term partnerships.
	Conduct regular client visits to ensure product satisfaction and identify upselling opportunities.
	Liaise with the production team at the farm/processing site to ensure product availability aligns with sales forecasts.
	Oversee the logistics of starch delivery within Lagos State to ensure timely and professional distribution.
	Manage credit limits and ensure the timely collection of receivables.
	Prepare weekly and monthly sales reports, forecasting, and budget performance analysis.
	Maintain an updated CRM database of all prospects and existing clients.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Agricultural Science, or a related field.
	Minimum of 6 years of experience in B2B industrial sales, preferably within the FMCG or Agribusiness sector.
	Proven track record of selling industrial raw materials (starch, flour, or sweeteners) to large-scale manufacturers.
	Understanding of the industrial landscape in Lagos (Ikeja, Agbara, Ikorodu, etc.).
	Exceptional ability to close high-stakes deals with procurement managers and directors.
	Ability to discuss product specifications (moisture content, pH levels, viscosity) with client Quality Assurance teams.


Benefits


	Competitive Compensation.   
	5-day workweek.   
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).   
	Wellness Programs   
	Employee Training Programs   
	Growth and Development   
	Mentoring and Counseling.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Office Secretary Job at Grado Konnects




        
    

        
        At Grado Konnects, we specialize in transforming ideas into actionable strategies that drive growth for individuals and businesses alike. Our unique approach ensures that you receive tailored guidance with a focus on professional development and success.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Secretary

Job Location: Lagos Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Handle calls, emails, and office correspondence
	Schedule meetings and manage appointments
	Prepare and file documents
	Receive visitors and provide administrative support
	Manage office records and supplies


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an SSCE / OND / HND / BSc
	Basic computer skills (MS Word, Excel, email)
	Good communication and organizational skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: admin@gradokonnects.co.site using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Managing Director Job at AMSCO




        
    

        
        AMSCO, an HR advisory services company operating in Nigeria, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Managing Director

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	He must be adynamic and experienced Managing Director capable of providing excellent leadership in formulationg and executing growth strategies for the subsidiaries of a diversified group of companies.
	This position is essential for identifying and exploring investment opportunities to expand the group's portfolio.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ignatius.nwoha@amsco-africa.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
